task.title: How to Clean and Maintain Cast Iron Pans
task.shortdesc: The essential steps for cleaning and maintaining cast iron pans to ensure longevity and optimal performance.

taskbody.prereq: Regular cleaning and maintenance are essential for preserving the quality and longevity of your cast iron pan.

step.cmd: After each use, wash the pan with hot water and a soft sponge or brush, avoiding harsh detergents that can strip away the seasoning.
step.info: For stubborn food residue, use a paste made of kosher salt and water to gently scrub the surface.

step.cmd: Once clean, dry the pan thoroughly with a towel and place it on the stove over low heat to evaporate any remaining moisture.
Lastly, apply a light coating of oil to the pan to prevent rusting and maintain its seasoning.

info.p: Consult reputable sources like the National Sanitation Foundation (NSF) or cooking experts like America's Test Kitchen for comprehensive guidelines on cleaning and maintaining your cast iron cookware.
